net.xuset.objectIO.connections.sockets.tcp

Class TcpAcceptor<T extends InetCon>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xuset.objectIO.connections.sockets.tcp.TcpAcceptor<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - they type of InetCon that will be added

    public abstract class TcpAcceptor<T extends InetCon>
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that monitors a ServerSocket object for new TCP connections and adds them to the specified hub by calling addConnection on the hub.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TcpAcceptor(InetHub<T> hub, int port)
      Sole constructor for TcpAcceptor.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected abstract T createConnection(java.net.Socket s)
      Creates the appropriate connection (that extends InetCon) from a socket object.
      int getLocalPort()
      The returned port number is what remote sockets should try to connect to.
      protected boolean isAcceptable(java.net.InetAddress addr)
      Once a new socket has been created the address is passed here, and if the method returns true, the connection is created and added to the hub.
      void stop()
      Stops listening for new connections and closes the ServerSocket object.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

           int port)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Sole constructor for TcpAcceptor.
        Parameters:
        hub - hub to add the connections to
        port - port to listen for new connections on

    • Method Detail

      • createConnection

        protected abstract T createConnection(java.net.Socket s)
                                               throws java.io.IOException
        Creates the appropriate connection (that extends InetCon) from a socket object.
        Parameters:
        s - socket that will be used to create the connection
        Returns:
        the new connection
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a socket error occurs

      • getLocalPort

        public int getLocalPort()
        The returned port number is what remote sockets should try to connect to.
        Returns:
        the port the SocketServer is listening on.

      • isAcceptable

        protected boolean isAcceptable(java.net.InetAddress addr)
        Once a new socket has been created the address is passed here, and if the method returns true, the connection is created and added to the hub. If it returns false, the socket is closed. This method can be overridden to implement a white-list or black-list.
        Parameters:
        addr - address in question
        Returns:
        true if the connection should be created and added

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops listening for new connections and closes the ServerSocket object.
